Header.title: MAPISM
Header.paragraph: Navigate with Confidence: Your Trusted GIS Companion

About.paragraph: Our tourism-focused GIS design prioritizes usability and responsiveness, offering dynamically-changing elements, informative color schemes, a user-configurable interface, and layering functionality for enhanced user experience and accurate information retrieval.

Docs.description: Enable users to search for intersections between two streets, which is helpful in using the map for pathfinding without browsing the map directly. The user enters the street names into the map, and the intersection name appears underneath. The search function has prefix autocompletion, which improves usability by allowing users to input information into the search bar efficiently, as well as preventing spelling or formatting mistakes in the inputs.

Implement Levenshtein distance-based autocompletion to suggest relevant options for user input. This makes the process of entering information into the map shorter, and by extension, improves the search experience for users.
Format directions using Pango/Markup to improve the appearance and readability of the text and graphics of the map, and by extension, provide clear guidance for navigation.

Allow users to export directions as HTML files. This enhances the usability of the application by enabling it to be useful without an internet connection, as well as enabling it to be shared with others.
Provide arrow keys functionality for manually moving around the map, offering users an intuitive way to navigate the map viewport.

Include zoom in, zoom out, and fit buttons to facilitate easy adjustment of the map view. This gives the user the option to see the map as a whole, as well as viewing specific points on the map in great detail, which gives the user a great deal of control over what they see.
Integrate a debug bar to display relevant information and assist developers in troubleshooting and optimizing the application, as well as providing curious users with extra information.

Incorporate a weather widget powered by an API to provide users with real-time weather information, providing the user with highly useful information for planning a trip, which in tandem with the pathfinding features, provide a greatly cohesive user experience.
Integrate a country API to retrieve and display country-specific data, which allows users access to information on their immediate surroundings, which is highly useful in planning a trip.

Leverage Cohere API to generate insights and enhance user experience by providing realtime data of Points of Interest within the application. This improves the user experience by providing extra information on the point of interest in question that users can use to enrich the trip planning process.

Implement map overlays to highlight intersections, allowing users to interact with the map easier, as well as highlight intersections for the pathfinding function so that it can plan routes between intersections.
Display points of interest (POIs) on the map using PNG images, allowing users to gain context on what each POI is, so that they can get an idea on if or if not they are interested in the POI.

Implement zoom-based loading to optimize performance by only loading data that is necessary at the zoom level in question. Loading too much data for the zoom level will hurt performance, while loading too little data could result in the display missing information.
Utilize tiling, viewport rendering, and culling techniques to efficiently render map data, ensuring efficient, fast, and smooth performance and the quick responsiveness of the map to user input.
Include a map drop-down menu to allow users to select different maps of cities without need of re compilation, enhancing customization and usability.
Incorporate expander UIs to organize and present large amounts of complex information or settings in a user-friendly and accessible manner.
Implement a collapsible side bar to ensure there is space to maximize the display's clarity and provide users with control over the visibility of additional information or features.
Include a settings menu to allow users to customize various aspects of the application according to their preferences, such as the display color, enhancing usability and personalization.
Provide access to external documentation within the application to offer users additional resources and support, facilitating learning and troubleshooting.
Incorporate a help dialog to provide users with guidance and instructions on using different features and functionalities of the application.
Implement tooltips to offer contextual information and guidance without needing to use the feature directly, enhancing user understanding and interaction with various elements of the application.
Optimize performance by preloading reusable essential resources or data to reduce loading times and provide a seamless and efficient user experience.
Integrate A* pathfinding algorithm with optimized heuristic to efficiently determine the shortest routes between intersections, and provide accurate navigation directions.
Allow users to customize the application's appearance by providing CSS-based theming options, enhancing visual appeal and personalization.
Offer alternative color schemes (like Dark Mode and Invert Mode) to cater to users with different preferences or visual impairments, improving accessibility and user satisfaction.
Enable users to toggle map elements or layers, such as points of interest (POI) and intersections, to customize the displayed information based on their preferences and needs.

Incorporate animated map overlays to provide dynamic visual feedback. This enhance the user experience by providing users with engaging and interactive map interactions to view, and presents information in a clearer way.
Allow users to select and highlight paths or directions on the map, facilitating easier navigation and route planning by focusing on specific routes or segments.
Introduce a map router feature to assist users in planning itineraries by calculating optimal routes and providing detailed directions between multiple destinations.
